text: Love Under Fire is a 1937 American drama film based upon the play by Walter C. Hackett. It was directed by George Marshall and stars Loretta Young, Don Ameche and Frances Drake.Dick, Bernard F. (2005) The Star-Spangled Screen: The American World War II Film. University Press of Kentucky, p.14 The film's sets were designed by the art director Rudolph Sternad. ==Plot== During the Spanish Civil War, a detective from Scotland Yard falls in love with a woman he had believed to be a jewel thief. ==Cast== * Loretta Young as Myra Cooper * Don Ameche as Tracy Egan * Borrah Minevitch as himself * Frances Drake as Pamela Beaumont * Walter Catlett as Tip Conway * John Carradine as Capt. Delmar * Sig Ruman as General Montero * Harold Huber as Lieutenant Chaves * Katherine DeMille as Rosa * E.E. Clive as Captain Bowden * Don Alvarado as Lieutenant Cabana * Georges Renavent as Captain Contreras * Clyde Cook as Bert * George Regas as Lieutenant De Vega * Claude King as Cunningham * John Bleifer as Juan * Agostino Borgato as Cab Driver * Egon Brecher as Civilian ==References== ==External links== * Category:1937 films Category:English-language films Category:American films Category:American war drama films Category:Films directed by George Marshall Category:Spanish Civil War films Category:20th Century Fox films Category:American black-and-white films Category:1930s war drama films Category:Films scored by Arthur Lange Category:1937 drama films
